elements.content:
<ce:section-title>Abstract</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para view="all">4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-5,7-dioxo-[1,2,4]triazolo-[1,5-a]pyrimidine (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>tpO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>) has been synthesized as well as its monosodic salt, the crystal structure of the latter having been determined by X-ray diffraction. H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>tpO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> possesses a very acidic active methylene group, as indicated by its dissociation constant (p<ce:italic>K</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">al</ce:inf> = 2.9). One of the hydrogen atoms in this group could then migrate to a basic position of the molecule, generating a zwitterionic or enolic form, nevertheless molecular orbital calculations point to the tautomer that keeps the CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> group as the most stable one.</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-5,7-dioxo-[1,2,4]triazolo-[1,5-a]pyrimidine (H2tpO2) has been synthesized as well as its monosodic salt, the crystal structure of the latter having been determined by X-ray diffraction. H2tpO2 possesses a very acidic active methylene group, as indicated by its dissociation constant (pK al = 2.9). One of the hydrogen atoms in this group could then migrate to a basic position of the molecule, generating a zwitterionic or enolic form, nevertheless molecular orbital calculations point to the tautomer that keeps the CH2 group as the most stable one.

elements.content:
<ce:simple-para view="all">The anionic form HtpO<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup>
<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> is generated by the elimination of one of the protons at C6 rather than that attached to N4, as indicated by NMR data and also by the X-ray diffraction data of Na(HtpO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O, this being consistent with theoretical calculations. The role of the molecular orbitals of HtpO<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup>
<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> in possible coordination to metal ions is discussed.</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text: The anionic form HtpO- 2 is generated by the elimination of one of the protons at C6 rather than that attached to N4, as indicated by NMR data and also by the X-ray diffraction data of Na(HtpO2)⋅2H2O, this being consistent with theoretical calculations. The role of the molecular orbitals of HtpO- 2 in possible coordination to metal ions is discussed.
